content: how will i know yaya lovestoknit december 27 2023 corrected 01/03/2024 i m a knitter this is only my 2nd crochet hat pattern crochet is fast and if you need to rip back because of a boo-boo it s not as heartbreaking crochet stitches create a different look and produces a completed project in much less time than a knit one the sample hat was completed in less than 3 hours this easy to make hat is worked from the top down and begins with just 12 stitches so no worries about twists in a long set-up chain the stitches you ll need to use include the chain stitch slip_stitch single and double_crochet and cluster stitches the combination of these stitches will produce a simple texture for a hat that can be appropriate for any gender the pattern as written will fit an average adult size head but can easily be adjusted for other sizes by decreasing or increasing the number of increase rounds in the crown and/or the number of rounds in the body of the hat the nice thing about crocheting a hat from the top down is that you can try it on as you work … no surprise sizing issues when you finish hope you ll give this pattern a try for knitters and other beginngers who want to try crochet or who have struggled with it in the past how will you know if you don t try song of the day how will i know whitney houston 1985 https //youtu be/m3-hy-hlhbg size the sample hat measures 9 from top to bottom and 20 around the bottom band unstretched there s enough ease to fit an average adult size head yarn the sample hat was crocheted using 75 7 grams 142 yards of red heart chic sheep 100% superwash wool 100 grams/186 yards per skein chic sheep is a slightly firmer yarn so i chose to work with it using a j hook to get a soft fabric 1 | p a ge you may have noticed the shorter yardage for a skein of chic sheep most 100-gram skeins of superwash wool have 218 or 220 yards if you choose a yarn that s softer you may want to consider a smaller hook size depending on your personal gauge it s easy to work this hat using multiple colors too a good project for balls of yarn leftover from other projects just be sure the yarns are the same weight and fiber content hook j hook/6 0 mm other tools stitch marker tapestry/darning needle unlike stitch markers used in knit projects crochet stitch marker must to be removable but no need to make an extra purchase you can use a paper clip or hair pin or my fave which is just a plastic tapestry needle with a short length of contrasting yarn attached easy to insert into the stitch and remove when necessary the little length of
